verses.verse: Now <S%G1161><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> the collection <S%G3048><s%> for the saints, <S%G40><s%> as I have given order <S%G1299><s%> to the churches <S%G1577><s%> of Galatia, <S%G1053><s%> even <S%G2532><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> do <S%G4160><s%> you.

On the first <S%G3391><s%> day of the week <S%G4521><s%> let every <S%G1538><s%> one of you lay <S%G5087><s%> by him in store, <S%G2343><s%> as God has prospered <S%G2137><s%> him, that there be no <S%G3361><s%> gatherings <S%G3048><s%> when <S%G3752><s%> I come. <S%G2064><s%>

And when <S%G3752><s%> I come, <S%G3854><s%> whomsoever <S%G3739><s%> <S%G1437><s%> you shall approve <S%G1381><s%> by your letters, <S%G1992><s%> them will I send <S%G3992><s%> to bring <S%G667><s%> your <S%G5216><s%> liberality <S%G5485><s%> to Jerusalem. <S%G2419><s%>
And if <S%G1437><s%> it be meet <S%G514><s%> that I go <S%G4198><s%> also, <S%G2504><s%> they shall go <S%G4198><s%> with me.

Now <S%G1161><s%> I will come <S%G2064><s%> to you, when <S%G3752><s%> I shall pass <S%G1330><s%> through <S%G1330><s%> Macedonia: <S%G3109><s%> for I do pass <S%G1330><s%> through <S%G1330><s%> Macedonia. <S%G3109><s%>

And it may be that I will abide, <S%G3887><s%> yes, <S%G2228><s%> and winter <S%G3914><s%> with you, that you may bring <S%G4311><s%> me on my journey wherever <S%G3757><s%> <S%G1437><s%> I go. <S%G4198><s%>

For I will <S%G2309><s%> not see <S%G1492><s%> you now <S%G737><s%> by the way; <S%G3938><s%> but I trust <S%G1679><s%> to tarry <S%G1961><s%> a while <S%G5550><s%> <S%G5099><s%> with you, if <S%G1437><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%> permit. <S%G2010><s%>
But I will tarry <S%G1961><s%> at <S%G1722><s%> Ephesus <S%G2181><s%> until <S%G2193><s%> Pentecost. <S%G4005><s%>
For a great <S%G3173><s%> door <S%G2374><s%> and effectual <S%G1756><s%> is opened <S%G455><s%> to me, and there are many <S%G4183><s%> adversaries. <S%G480><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> Timotheus <S%G5095><s%> come, <S%G2064><s%> see <S%G991><s%> that he may be with you without <S%G870><s%> fear: <S%G870><s%> for he works <S%G2038><s%> the work <S%G2041><s%> of the Lord, <S%G2962><s%> as I also <S%G2532><s%> do.

Let no <S%G3361><s%> man <S%G5100><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> despise <S%G1848><s%> him: but conduct <S%G4311><s%> him forth <S%G4311><s%> in peace, <S%G1515><s%> that he may come <S%G2064><s%> to me: for I look <S%G1551><s%> for him with the brothers. <S%G80><s%>

As touching <S%G4012><s%> our brother <S%G80><s%> Apollos, <S%G625><s%> I greatly <S%G4183><s%> desired <S%G3870><s%> him to come <S%G2064><s%> to you with the brothers: <S%G80><s%> but his will <S%G2307><s%> was not at <S%G3843><s%> all <S%G3843><s%> to come <S%G2064><s%> at <S%G3568><s%> this <S%G3568><s%> time; <S%G3568><s%> but he will come <S%G2064><s%> when <S%G3752><s%> he shall have convenient <S%G2119><s%> time. <S%G2119><s%>
Watch <S%G1127><s%> you, stand <S%G4739><s%> fast in the faith, <S%G4102><s%> quit <S%G407><s%> you like <S%G407><s%> men, <S%G407><s%> be strong. <S%G2901><s%>
Let all <S%G3956><s%> your <S%G5216><s%> things be done <S%G1096><s%> with charity. <S%G26><s%>

I beseech <S%G3870><s%> you, brothers, <S%G80><s%> (you know <S%G1492><s%> the house <S%G3614><s%> of Stephanas, <S%G4734><s%> that it is the first fruits <S%G536><s%> of Achaia, <S%G882><s%> and that they have addicted <S%G5021><s%> themselves <S%G1438><s%> to the ministry <S%G1248><s%> of the saints, <S%G40><s%>)
That you submit <S%G5293><s%> yourselves to such, <S%G5108><s%> and to every <S%G3956><s%> one that helps <S%G4903><s%> with us, and labors. <S%G2872><s%>

I am glad <S%G5463><s%> of the coming <S%G3952><s%> of Stephanas <S%G4734><s%> and Fortunatus <S%G5415><s%> and Achaicus: <S%G883><s%> for that which was lacking <S%G5303><s%> on your <S%G5216><s%> part they have supplied. <S%G378><s%>
For they have refreshed <S%G373><s%> my spirit <S%G4151><s%> and your's: <S%G5216><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> acknowledge <S%G1921><s%> you them that are such. <S%G5108><s%>

The churches <S%G1577><s%> of Asia <S%G773><s%> salute <S%G782><s%> you. Aquila <S%G207><s%> and Priscilla <S%G4252><s%> salute <S%G782><s%> you much <S%G4183><s%> in the Lord, <S%G2962><s%> with the church <S%G1577><s%> that is in their house. <S%G3624><s%>
All <S%G3956><s%> the brothers <S%G80><s%> greet <S%G782><s%> you. Greet <S%G782><s%> you one <S%G240><s%> another <S%G240><s%> with an holy <S%G40><s%> kiss. <S%G5370><s%>
The salutation <S%G783><s%> of me Paul <S%G3972><s%> with my <S%G1699><s%> own <S%G1699><s%> hand. <S%G5495><s%>
If <S%G1487><s%> any <S%G1536><s%> man love <S%G5368><s%> not the Lord <S%G2962><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> Christ, <S%G5547><s%> let him be Anathema <S%G331><s%> Maranatha. <S%G3134><s%>
The grace <S%G5485><s%> of our Lord <S%G2962><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> Christ <S%G5547><s%> be with you.

My love <S%G26><s%> be with you all <S%G3956><s%> in Christ <S%G5547><s%> Jesus. <S%G2424><s%> Amen. <S%G281><s%> The first epistle to the Corinthians was written from Philippi by Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus and Timotheus.
